column2: FUSE extends macOS by adding support for user space file systems

column5:
(fuse) Fix statfs_x bug when using modules

Closes osxfuse/osxfuse#414

The MacPorts gnupg21 binary has been renamed gpg

For details see https://trac.macports.org/ticket/51650.

Post vnode events for remote file system changes

Some file systems, most notably network-based ones, need to notify the
kernel about external changes, so that, for example, Finder can reflect
them.

* Post vnode events when receiving FUSE_NOTIFY_INVAL_INODE and
  FUSE_NOTIFY_INVAL_ENTRY notifications

* Add support for FUSE_NOTIFY_DELETE notifications

* Post vnode events in case external changes are detected when loading
  a vnode's cached attributes
Add support for very big file systems
Update license header of shell scripts
(prefpane) Add retina version of FUSE logo
(fuse) Close device handle for unmounted volumes
(support) Alert if kernel extension is blocked

Move volume icon to file system bundle

FUSE will fall back to the default icon in case no volume icon was
specified, when mounting the volume. In previous releases the fallback
was only available to file systems linking against the FUSE framework.

Sign release instead of individual files

Signing files one at a time signs the contents of the files. However,
it does not protect the file names from being tampered with or prevent
adding or removing files from the release.

Signing a file containing the hash values and names of all release
files effectively signs the release as a whole.

(kext) Avoid reusing a soft-revoked vnode

There are two flavors for revoking vnodes, soft and hard.

* In case of a hard revoke the vnode is reclaimed immediately. As a
  result the vnode is removed from our vnode cache.

* In case of a soft revoke the vnode is only maked as revoked, but not
  reclaimed immediately. This means the vnode stays in the vnode cache
  until all open file handles are closed.

In case a file disappears "behind our back" the corresponding vnode is
soft-revoked. If a new file appears with the same inode number we need
to make sure not to reuse the revoked vnode.
(fuse) Add support for utime_omit_ok on macOS 10.13

Enable support for renaming FUSE volumes

Finder and the diskutil command line tool require renamed FUSE volumes
to be backed by a block device or a character device. FUSE volumes that
are not device-backed cannot be unmounted using Finder or diskutil. The
device node's path can be set using the fsname mount-time option.

Fix distribution package macOS version check

Use deployment target as fallback when building distribution target
without --kext argument.

(fuse) Use disk arbitration for managing volumes

* Store DADiskRef for every mounted volume
* Use disk arbitration to unmount volumes
* Remove legacy mount hash

Fix CMSG alignment in Mac OS X 10.5 SDK

FUSE uses a socket pair to pass the FUSE device file descriptor to the
file system process. Control messages created using the CMSG macros in
the Mac OS X 10.5 SDK are not properly aligned. This resulted in 32 bit
file systems being unresponsive on 64 bit Macs.
Fix distribution package macOS version check
(prefpane) Add support for preferences URL scheme

Add support for nanosecond time resolution

Close osxfuse/osxfuse#346

Fix rare deadlock when mounting volume

In rare cases mount(2) performs file system operations. Calling
mount_osxfuse synchronously can result a file system deadlock.

Rename distribution package symlink

Append .pkg file extension to distribution package symlink in release
disk image.
(framework) Fix BridgeSupport on Mac OS X 10.6
(support) Fix build error with legacy SDKs
(support) Fix build warning on Mac OS X 10.6

Let mount_osxfuse load the kernel extension

From now on mount_osxfuse is responsible for calling load_osxfuse. This
allows us to further decouple libosxfuse from the FUSE kernel
extension.
(kext) Lock parent directory when removing entry
(kext) Fix ".." path handling for delete lookups
(kext) Don't kill the file system on short reads

Add mount-time option excl_create

The macOS kernel expects all create calls to return EEXIST in case the
file already exists, regardless of whether O_EXCL was specified or not.
To ensure this the FUSE kernel extension will set the O_EXCL flag for
every FUSE_CREATE request sent to user space.

If the mount-time option excl_create is specified, the O_EXCL flag will
only be set for "truly" exclusive creates, i.e. create calls for which
the initiator explicitly set the O_EXCL flag. This allows network file
systems to determine whether or not to acquire a potentially costly
lock to prevent remote create races. Nonetheless, the file system still
needs to make sure that there are no local create races.
(kext) Always set O_EXCL for FUSE_CREATE requests
(kext) Ignore vncache hits when creating a file
(kext) Remove task working set cache handling

Add support for Xcode 8

* Add option --provisioning-profile to set Xcode setting
  PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER

* Update code sign and product sign identity in release target
Add experimental support for macOS 10.12 SDK
Change OS name from OS X to macOS
Clean up shell script license header
(kext) Fix invisible volume on OS X 10.8
Drop support for OS X 10.8 and earlier
(support) Drop support for old style mount process

Bump number of osxfuse devices to 64

Addresses osxfuse/osxfuse#277
Lower minimum file system block size to 128 bytes

Increase maximum file system block size to 1 MiB

Increase maximum file system block size from MAXPHYS (128 KiB) to
MAXBSIZE (1 MiB).
(fuse, support) Implement new style mount process
(framework) Use weak linking for backward compatibility
(fuse) Disable CUSE support on OS X
(kext) Be more verbose in case vnop_readdir fails
(kext) Send interrupt request on daemon timeout
Add build instructions for using Homebrew
(build) Add OS X 10.11 section to Release.plist
(kext) Fix select(2) for FUSE device on OS X 10.11
(kext) Fix opening quarantined files with Preview
(kext) Do not unlock already unlocked lock in VFSOP sync
(prefpane) Use HTTPS to fetch list of releases
(build) Hide xcodebuild output if verbose not set
(kext) Cache vnode attributes when creating vnode
(kext) Invalidate directory attributes when creating file
Merge branch 'readme-fix' of git://github.com/flandr/osxfuse into master
(fuse) Do not call fuse_fs_getattr for NULL path

Add 'gettext' to list of required ports

As discussed in issue #149, this package provides the AM_ICONV macro
needed in autoconf.
(kext) Fix unset fuse_open_in mode for ABI < 7.12
(build) Add preliminary support for OS X 10.11

(build) Use dirname and basename for paths

Do not rely on shell parameter expansion for paths. dirname and
basename are better at handling edge cases.
(support) Fix check if weak function exists
(kext) Write back changes when unmapping file
Switch back to GitHub for hosting releases
Add support for OS X specific capability flags
(build, kext) Determine maximum I/O size at runtime

Fixes an issue with building under 10.5.

The 10.5 version of "cp" doesn't support the "-a" option, though
it's just a shorthand for "-pPR", so it's easily fixed.
(build) Use llvm-gcc for Mac OS X 10.6 builds
(kext) Set attr_valid to zero when initializing vnodes

(build) Fix view options of disk image

Wait for 4 seconds after adjusting the view options of the release disk
image. Shorter waits occasionally result in an error on OS X 10.10.

(build) Target "release" on OS X 10.10

Add support for building target "release" on OS X 10.10.
(support) Fix uninstaller resource path on Mac OS X 10.5
(framework) Add support for setting optimal file I/O size
(framework, macfuse_framework) Use proper macro to enable 64 bit inodes
Increase maximum I/O size to 32 MiB

(fuse, kext) Extend setattr operation

* (fuse) Add setattr bkuptime/crtime workaround

* (fuse) Add nopath support for operation fsetattr_x

* (kext) Add nopath support for operation fsetattr_x
(build, prefpane, support) Do not build tools for ppc64

(prefpane) Cleanup

* Use the term "FUSE for OS X" instead of OSXFUSE

* Remove checks for Mac OS X 10.4

(build, support) Revise installer and uninstaller

* (build) Fix detection of MacFUSE compatibility layer 2.x

* (support) Handle upgrade from osxfuse 2.x

* (support) Refactor uninstaller for shared libraries
(build) Add function to unload kernel extensions

(build) Refactor build script

Split build script into reusable libraries

(build) Switch to stock version of bash

The build script is compatible with the Mac OS X 10.6 stock version of
bash.
(framework) Add support for FUSE fallocate callback
(framework) Add support for case-insensitive Objective-C filesystems
(build, support) Move license to top-level of release disk image
(kext) Fix kernel panic related to Comodo Antivirus
(build) Move debug file into file system bundle

(build) Add sleep before detaching disk image

Without sleeping for one second prior to detaching the osxfuse
distribution disk image some window settings might get lost.

(build) Make build script mostly Mac OS X 10.6 compatible

Codesigning the file system bundle osxfuse.fs does not seem to work on
Mac OS X 10.6. But there is no need for codesigning on 10.6 anyway.

(build) Cleanup

* Extend preprocessor definitions extraction

* Fix code signing of file system bundle

* Strip libosxfuse and libfuse

* Use absolute path names of helper tools

(build) Fix productbuild and pkgbuild signing identity

Do not specify empty signing identity when calling productbuild or
pkgbuild.
Update README.md for OS X Yosemite
(support) Fix package identifiers in uninstall scripts
Update README.md for rewritten build script
Add support for OS X Yosemite
(fuse) Add support for case insensitive file systems
(support) Check if prefpane is installed before trying to uninstall it
Use pkgbuild instead of PackageMaker to build installer packages

Use /bin/cp instead of cp in PATH

Addresses issue https://github.com/osxfuse/osxfuse/issues/74
(fuse) Call asprintf, sentenv, and proc_pidpath before fork

Update README.md

* Add information about Xcode 5.0/5.0.1 and PackageMaker

* Xcode 4.0, 4.1, and 4.2 are unsupported on Mac OS X 10.6
(framework) Fix error parameter handling in fusefm_mkdir
Fix return code handling in m_exit_on_error

Fix option parsing

Use the following options to specify a custom Developer ID for signing code and
installer package.

-j identity
   sign the code with the specified signing identity
-i identity
   sign the installer package with the specified signing identity

Improve lookup of Developer ID certificates

Use security find-certificate to look up Developer ID certificates for signing
kernel extension and resulting installer package.
Build OS X 10.9 kernel extension with Xcode 5.0
(installer) Use term "Fuse for OS X" instead of "OSXFUSE"
GitHub Pages have been moved to github.io
Switch to SourceForge for hosting files

Add build parameters

* M_OSXFUSE_ENABLE_KEXT_VERSION_CHECK

  If enabled OSXFUSE will refuse to mount FUSE volumes in case the version of
  the already loaded OSXFUSE kernel extension does not match the version of the
  user space library.

* OSXFUSE_MIN_DARWIN_VERSION

  Specifies the minimum supported Darwin version. An error message is displayed
  in case OSXFUSE is run on an earlier version.

(kext, support) Remove unused mount-time option init_timeout

daemon_timeout is used to detect timeouts during FUSE_INIT handshakes.

(support) Fix name of user space daemon

mount displays instance@osxfuse0 instead of <daemon name>@osxfuse0. Fixed by
renaming environment variable MOUNT_OSXFUSEFS_DAEMON_PATH
MOUNT_OSXFUSE_DAEMON_PATH
(framework) Make sure DefaultVolumeIcon.icns exists before using it
Adapt license to new source tree structure

(framework, kext, support) Update bundle information

* Remove unused OSXFUSE_BUILD_FLAVOR variable

* Change framework bundle identifier to com.github.osxfuse.frameworks.OSXFUSE

Reorganize source tree and file system bundle

* Add support repository as git submodule

* Move packaging files to support repositiry

* Clean up kext repository and move helper tools to support repository

* Rename submodule macfuse fuse-macfuse. Note that we need to add another
  submodule for MacFUSE.framework.

* Update prefpane to reflect changes in the source tree

* Rename file system bundle osxfusefs.fs osxfuse.fs

* Move helper tools in filesystem bundle from directory osxfuse.fs/Support to
  osxfuse.fs/Contents/Resources

* Update license for 2013
Move common header files from kext/common to common

Specify build directory when calling xcodebuild.

This allows both shared and project-specific Xcode configurations
to successfully build OSXFUSE.

Update lib(osx)fuse

* Fix detection of osxfuse device in fuse_kern_unmount

* Update libosxfuse to version 2.9.1
Fix "bad array subscript" bug in m_version_compare

Use perl instead of grep to extract substrings

The version of grep, that ships with OS X 10.8 does no longer support Perl
regular expressions (grep option -P), therefore use perl instead.

Conflicts:
	build.sh
Mac OS X 10.7 SDK can be used to build OSXFUSE for OS X 10.8
(fuse, kext, macfuse) Implement asynchronous FUSE_INIT handshake

(fuse) Remove unnamed POSIX semaphore implementation from headers

FUSE file systems compiled against older version of libosxfuse will still work
after this change.

Update preinstall and postinstall scripts

Make sure that /usr/local/lib and /usr/local/include are readable

Do not build separate kernel extension for OS X 10.7 or 10.8

If Mac OS X SDK 10.6 is available, build the kernel extension for Mac OS X 10.6
and use this build on Mac OS X 10.6, 10.7 and 10.8. At this point the kernel
code for 10.6, 10.7 and 10.8 is effectively identical.

Make working with kernel panic logs easier

Kernel panic logs generated with a non-debug build could not be symbolicated
previous versions of OSXFUSE due to stripping all non-global symbols from th
kernel extension.

* (kext) Keep unstripped kernel extension for debugging

* Store unstripped kernel extension in build dir
Store libfuse debug symbols in OSXFUSE.framework/Resources/Debug/
Fix bug in detecting source root
Fix help message of build script

Sign installer package for Gatekeeper

* (target release) The signing identity can be specified using option -i. If no
  signing identity is specified, try to sign the package with the following
  identity:

  "Developer ID Installer: {real name of user}"

* (target release) The key file used to sign the update rules file can be
  specified using option -u. If no key is specified and
  "$HOME/.osxfuse_private_key" does not exist, use the test key
  "./prefpane/autoinstaller/TestKeys/private_key.der".

  Note:

  The private key is used to sign the file CurrentRelease.plist or
  DeveloperRelease.plist (in case of a beta release). These files represent the
  server-side of the update mechanism. Using the test key has no impact on the
   resulting binaries or the ability to update OSXFUSE.
Fix MacFUSE Compatibility Layer detection in uninstaller

Update License.rtf in release disk image

See commit d5754efc687d456ea80ed13e39997ee928094f98.

Don't build the "Redist" package

The "Redist" package has never been used and has become obsolete with the
introduction the "fat" file system bundle. Now, there is just one core package,
which can easily be included in third-party distribution installer packages.

Add build target "release"

* Rework target "dist". "dist" used to create the the OSXFUSE distribution
  package OSXFUSE.pkg, the wrapping disk image OSXFUSE-{version}.dmg, and the
  signed updater file (Current|Developer)Release.plist.

  Creating the diskimage and the updater files has been moved to the new build
  target "release". This is done to simplyfy building a OSXFUSE installer
  package without the overhead of creating a disk image or having to provide a
  signing key. Most of the time these additional steps are not needed.

  To build the OSXFUSE installer package run the following command in the cloned
  repository:

  ./build.sh -t dist

* Update copyrights

* Bump version of build tool to 2.0
(fuse, macfuse) Fix Makefiles for example file systems

Introduce new "fat" file system bundle

* (kext) The "fat" file system bundle contains all individual builds of the
  kernel extension for Mac OS X 10.5, 10.6, and 10.7. The builds are located at:

  osxfusefs.fs/Support/10.[5-8]/osxfusefs.kext

  The load_osxfusefs tool automatically pick the kernel extension matching the
  currently running version of OS X.

* Add build target "osxfusefs" that builds the "fat" file system bundle.

* Target "smalldist" does no longer build a "small" core package for just one
  version of OS X. The new core package works on all supported versions of
  OS X and includes the file system bundle osxfusefs.fs, the user space library
  libosxfuse, and OSXFUSE.framework.

Add parameter "install_to" to function "m_build_pkg"

This parameter allows to specifiy the install prefix for the payload of an
installer package.

Rework build target "reload"

Target "reload" is just a wrapper for target "kext". It unloads the kernel
extension, builds target "kext", and reloads the newly built extension.

Add build target "kext"

Target "kext" builds the OSXFUSE kernel extension for a specific platform.

(fuse, macfuse) Update libosxfuse and libfuse/libfuse_ino64

* Update libosxfuse to version 2.8.0

* Use independant libfuse/libfuse_ino64 2.7.3 libraries for MacFUSE instead of
  libosxfuse adapter. These libraries guarantee compatibility with the latest
  official MacFUSE release: 2.0.3/2.1.5.

* Drop libosxfuse_i32 because it is not longer needed for the MacFUSE
  libosxfuse adapter.
(kext) Fix compiler warning/error in case of non-debug build

(framework, fuse, kext) Use __APPLE__ instead of (__FreeBSD__ >= 10)

Use macro __APPLE__ instead of abusing macro __FreeBSD__ to identify Darwin.

Build libosxfuse_i32 and libosxfuse_i64 at the same time

libosxfuse_i32 and libosxfuse_i64 used to be built separately by the build
script by manually patching lib/Makefile.
Create submodule for MacFUSE libosxfuse_i32/libosxfuse_i64 adapter

Compatibility fixes for Xcode 4.3 and later

* (fuse, kext) Remove dependency on "Command Line Tools" package.

* (prefpane) Don't treat warnings as errors
  - OpenSSL is deprecated starting with OS X 10.7.
  - Function AuthorizationExecuteWithPrivileges is deprecated.

Note: The Xcode "Command Line Tools" package is still needed to generate
BridgeSupport metadata for OSXFUSE.framework because of a bug in
gen_bridge_metadata, which expects cpp to be in /usr/bin:

/usr/bin/gen_bridge_metadata:59:in `basename': can't convert nil into String (TypeError)
	from /usr/bin/gen_bridge_metadata:59
Add Xcode 4.3 PackageMaker.app note to README
Add information about Xcode 4.3 to README
Add provisional support for OS X 10.8

Add support for Xcode 4.3

Note: Xcode 4.3 does no longer include autotools (aclocal, autoconf, autoheader,automake, autoreconf, ...) and glibtoolize. But these tools are needed to buildlibosxfuse and have to be installed manually.

Install MacPorts and run the following command in Terminal:
sudo port install autoconf automake libtool
Use --recursive flag when cloning the repository

Remove "Mac" in "FUSE for Mac OS X"

OS X Mountain Lion drops the "Mac"

This reverts commit ab31a96091614cfd60ce0a6480b25d91fc2f1fc3.

Bump version number to 2.3.9

* (kext) Fix fuse_vnop_create/fuse_vnop_open race condition in
  fuse_internal_strategy

* (kext) Fix calculation of va_data_alloc

* (kext) Fix deadlock in fuse_vnop_mmap

* (kext) Set VFS ioattr for mount point when mounting a file system

* (kext) Check if vnode is being recycled before calling vnode_recycle

* (kext) Implement mount-time option slow_statfs and enable
  VOL_CAP_FMT_FAST_STATFS by default because this is the expected behaviour in
  most cases

* (framework) Fix a small error in comment

Update OSXFUSE licensing information

* Update copyright year

* Add Fuse4X section

Use Mac OS X 10.5 user space libraries on Mac OS X 10.6 and 10.7

This allows building PowerPC file systems on Mac OS X 10.6 and 10.7 if an
appropriate version of Xcode is installed (e.g. Xcode 3.2.6).

The user space libraries are part of the OSXFUSE core package. There are three
distinct core packages for Mac OS X 10.5, 10.6 and 10.7. At the moment they all
share the same user space libraries which results in a unnecessary large
installer package. This issue will be addressed in OSXFUSE 2.4 and requires
some more or less extensive changes to the build script and the installer
package structure.
Add "Mac" in "FUSE for Mac OS X"
Copy debug symbols of osxfusefs.kext to platform build directory
Add README.md containing basic build instructions
Update license and remove old changelog

Add support for Xcode 4.2

Due to the fact that GCC 4.2 has been discontinued with the release of
Xcode 4.2, default to LLVM GCC 4.2 on Xcode 4.2.

Introduce basic redistribution package

Due to the fact that distribution packages cannot be added to other distribution
packages, wrap the OSXFUSE distribution package "OSXFUSE.pkg" in an otherwise
empty component package. OSXFUSE is installed silently by the wrapper's
postinstall script which invokes /usr/sbin/installer.

Fix a typo in xcodebuild path in function "m_handler_dist"

Reported by Peter Chang
Use GitHub's download service to host releases
Use GCC 4.2 to build OSXFUSE for all supported versions of OS X

Fix a bug in the kernel extension that triggers a deadlock the second time a
MacFUSE file system is mounted

When a MacFUSE file system is mounted the sysctl "osxfuse.control.macfuse_mode"
is set to 1. Each time that happens the kernel extension registers MacFUSE's
sysctls. Registering already registered sysctls triggers a deadlock.

Closes issue #10: Deadlock when multiple MacFUSE file systems are mounted

Use GCC 4.2 to build osxfusefs.kext for OS X 10.5

The kernel extension does not load on OS X 10.5/ppc, if build with Xcode 3.2
and LLVM-GCC 4.2. LLVM-GCC 4.2 seems to ignore the compiler flag
"-mlong-branch" (ppc only), which is implied by the flag "-mkernel". This
causes relocation overflow errors when loading osxfusefs.kext on OS X 10.5/ppc.
Using GCC 4.2 fixes this issue.

Closes issue #9: osxfusefs.kext does not load on OS X 10.5/ppc

Add basic support for OS X 10.5 (ppc, ppc64, i386, x86_64)

* The build script locates all Xcode installations in the top-level of th root
  file system.

* OSXFUSE can be build against OS X SDKs 10.5, 10.6 and 10.7 using Xcode 3.2,
  Xcode 4.0 and Xcode 4.1. The latest Xcode version including a specific SDK
  has the highest priority for building OSXFUSE against this SDK.

  SDK 10.5:    Xcode 3.2
  SDK 10.6:    Xcode 4.1, Xcode 4.0, Xcode 3.2
  SDK 10.7:    Xcode 4.1

* ppc/ppc64 binaries are only installed on OS X 10.5. I a future release
  universal binaries will be available on OS X 10.6 and 10.7, too.
Make uninstaller compatible with OS X 10.5

Fix version number in CurrentRelease.plist/DeveloperRelease.plist and remove
update rule for OS X 10.5

Fix deadlock issue on 64 bit kernel as seen with EncFS under heavy I/O

Release biglock before calling "int msleep(...)" and reacquire it after wakeup.
The kernel extension calls msleep in function "int fticket_wait_answer(...)"
when waiting for an response from the user space daemon. This can lead to a
deadlock, if the user space daemon inadvertently causes an operation on the
FUSE file system.

Closes issue #7: Deadlock in filesystem
Remove dependency of libosxfuse on gettext's config.rpath

Do not disable status bar for distribution disk image

The state of the status bar seems to be a global setting in OS X 10.7.
Disabling it in the build script for the distribution dist image will disable
it for all Finder windows.
Add copyright notice to help message of build script (./build.sh -h)

Re-add support for building OSXFUSE on OS X 10.6 and Xcode 4.0

Support for OS X 10.6/Xcode 4.0 had been disabled in commit
9f8209206fa5c4e8b6fca387d5cd8c2e76795954 (Introduce "fat" distribution package
...).

* On OS X 10.6 Xcode 4.0.0 or later is required. The resulting distribution
  package (target dist) is not compatible with OS X 10.7. It only contains
  installation packages for OS X 10.6.

* On OS X 10.7 Xcode 4.1.0 or later is required. The distribution package will
  contain installation packages for OS X 10.6 and OS X 10.7.
Update links to APSL and HashNode.c in license

Allow a file system request if EUID/EGID of the request match the EUID/EGID of
the FUSE deamon

This fixes an issue with OS X Lion's Finder which relies on a helper process
called Locum to perform some file system operations. Locum acts on behalf of
the current user (EUID/EGID) but its RUID/RGID are set to root/wheel.
MacFUSE/OSXFUSE used to allow file system requests only if EUID/EGID,
RUID/EGID and SVGID matched the EUID/EGID of the FUSE daemon.

Closes issue #5: Finder permissioning problem

Introduce "fat" distribution package containing different versions of the same
packages for different versions of OS X

For now the distribution package contains two versions of the OSXFUSE core
package (kernel extension and user space libraries) and the MacFUSE
compatibility layer for OS X 10.6 and OS X 10.7, respectively. The preferences
pane is compatible with either version of OS X.

Fix typo in function "m_set_platform"

Reported by Kees Bakker

Apply Tuxera's MacFUSE 2.2.0/1 patches

Tuxera's MacFUSE 2.2.0/1 branch:
https://github.com/tuxera/macfuse_with_externals/tree/tuxera

Closes issue #6

Add support for MacFUSE sysctl kernel parameters if run in MacFUSE
compatibility mode

Fix a bug in SDK that could result in the selector
"removeExtendedAttribute:ofItemAtPath:error:" never being called
Fix kernel module identifier and Xcode build target name
Add compatibility link "libfuse.0.dylib" for older MacFUSE file systems

Temporary disable support for OS X 10.5

A kernel extension targeting OS X 10.5 has to be compiled against the 10.5
SDK. Neither Xcode 4 nor Xcode 4.1 include SDK 10.5 anymore.

Rework OSXFUSE distribution packaging

Use the flat package format that has been introduced in Leopard instead of the
older bundle package format. OSXFUSE is split up into four installer packages:

- OSXFUSECore.pkg
  Constains the kernel extension osxfusefs.kext, the user space libraries
  libosxfuse and the framework OSXFUSE.framework. This package is mandatory.

- OSXFUSEPrefPane.pkg
  Contains the OSXFUSE preference pane. This package is optional but
  recommended.

- OSXFUSEMacFUSE.pkg
  Contains the MacFUSE compatibility layer consisting of the adapter user
  space libraries libmacfuse and a link from MacFUSE.framework back to
  OSXFUSE.framework. Installing this package will properly uninstall MacFUSE,
  if is installed and prevent MacFUSE from being installed in the future.
  Installing this package is optional.

- OSXFUSE.pkg
  Is the distribution package and contains the three packages listed above.
  During the installation the user is prompted to select which components of
  OSXFUSE should be installed.

In contrast to the previous packaging concept which was introduced by MacFUSE
the distribution package does no longer check for newer versions of its
subpackages before actually installing OSXFUSE.
Replace MacFUSE update urls with OSXFUSE update urls
Update licensing information and welcome message of installer packages
Rename preference pane and fix libosxfuse's README.OSXFUSE
Rename core installer packages and final disk image
Disable Xcode 3 templates until they have been converted to Xcode 4
Use more descriptive IFPkgDescriptionTitles for installer packages

Change identifier of OSXFUSE preference pane to
com.github.osxfuse.OSXFUSEPrefPane and name of preferences file to
com.github.osxfuse.OSXFUSE.plist
Change product ID used for autoinstaller to com.github.osxfuse.OSXFUSE

Change identifier of OSXFUSE kernel extension to
com.github.osxfuse.filesystems.osxfusefs
Change CFBundleName and CFBundleIdentifier of installer packages
Use actual version number of package in Description.plist

Move MacFUSE compatibility layer to separate installer package
"MacFUSE Core.pkg"

The package "MacFUSE Core.pkg" comes bundled with the installer package
"OSXFUSE.pkg" and is installed by default. The identifier of the compatibility
layer package is "com.google.macfuse.core" to prevent the official MacFUSE
installer from overwriting it.
Remove debug symbols of libmacfuse from /usr/local/lib/
Link package config file fuse.pc back to osxfuse.pc

Return OSXFUSE version if function "const char *macfuse_version(void)" of
libmacfuse is invoked
Add support for OS X Lion to uninstaller script
Add support for OS X Lion to the build script

Add support for MacFUSE filesystems

Extend target smalldist of the build script:

- Build the wrapper libraries libmacfuse_i32 and libmacfuse_i64 that are
  binary compatible with MacFUSE's libfuse and libfuse_ino64, respectively.
  Links are placed in /usr/local/lib to point from libfuse/libfuse_ino64 to
  the appriproate wrapper for libosxfuse.

- Install a dummy MacFUSE.framework linking back to OSXFUSE.framework
Rename libosxfuse libosxfuse_i32 and libosxfuse_ino64 libosxfuse_i64
Rebrand submodules fuse, kext, prefpane and sdk as OSXFUSE

Update submodules fuse, kext, prefpane and sdk

Change location of private key file used to sign distribution packages

- If the environment variable OSXFUSE_PRIVATE_KEY is defined, the file it
  refers to is used to sign distribution packages
- If OSXFUSE_PRIVATE_KEY is not defined, the script uses the file
  $HOME/.osxfuse_private_key to sign distribution packages
- If the private key file could not be located, an error message is displayed
